The heauenly banquet: or The doctrine of the Lords Supper set forth in seuen sermons. With two prayers before and after the receiuing. And a iustification of kneeling in the act of receiuing. By Iohn Denison, Doctor of Diuinity. Denison, John, d. 1629.
The second impression.
[16], 364, [4] p., folded table
Printed by E[lizabeth] A[llde] for Robert Allot, and are to bee sold [by W. Brooks?] within the Turning-Stile in Holborne, London : 1631.
Bookseller's name conjectured by STC addendum. The first leaf is blank. "A iustification of the gesture of kneeling, in the act of receiuing the sacrament of the Lords Supper" has separate dated title page with "printed by Eliz. Allde" in imprint; pagination and register are continuous. Reproduction of the original in Cambridge University Library.
=======

The second impression.
[16], 364, [4] p., folded table
Printed by E[lizabeth] A[llde] for Robert Allot, and are to bee sold [by W. Brooks?] within the Turning-Stile in Holborne, London : 1631.
